intro: Thelypodium neglectum, commonly known as the common thelypodium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches a height of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Thelypodium neglectum is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
